sen.j: 帆足 万里（ほあし ばんり、安永7年1月15日 (旧暦)（1778年2月11日） － 嘉永5年6月14日 (旧暦)（1852年7月30日））は、江戸時代後期の儒学者・経世論。
sen.e: Banri HOASHI (February 11, 1778 - July 30, 1852) was a Confucianist and 経世論Keiseiron (written treatment of events, which was drafted for governing Japan in the Edo period) scholar, who lived during the late Edo period.

Banri HOASHI (February 11, 1778 - July 30, 1852) was a Confucianist and Keiseiron (written treatment of events, which was drafted for governing Japan in the Edo period) scholar, who lived during the late Edo period.

Banri HOASHI (February 11, 1778 - July 30, 1852) was a Confucianist and Keiseiron (written treatment of events, which was drafted for governing Japan in the Edo period) scholar, who lived during the late Edo period.

sen.j: 父は豊後国日出藩家老の帆足通文。
sen.e: His father was the chief retainer of Hiji Domain, Bungo Province
His father was the chief retainer of Hiji Domain, Bungo Province
His father was the chief retainer of Hiji Domain, Bungo Province

sen.j: 字は鵬卿。
sen.e: His 字azana (Chinese courtesy name which was, historically, the name formerly given to adult Chinese men, used in place of their given name in formal situations; scholars and the literati of Japan adopted this custom of courtesy name) was 鵬卿Hokyo (鵬卿).
sen.cmt: 鵬卿→正式な読み方が不明です：Hokyo (鵬卿)としました。
sen.e: His azana (Chinese courtesy name which was, historically, the name formerly given to adult Chinese men, used in place of their given name in formal situations; scholars and the literati of Japan adopted this custom of courtesy name) was Hokyo.

His azana (Chinese courtesy name which was, historically, the name formerly given to adult Chinese men, used in place of their given name in formal situations; scholars and the literati of Japan adopted this custom of courtesy name) was Hokyo.

sen.j: 号は愚亭など。
sen.e: His 号pseudonyms were 愚亭Gutei and others.
His pseudonyms were Gutei and others.
His pseudonyms were Gutei and others.

sen.j: 三浦梅園、広瀬淡窓と共に豊後三賢の一人と言われる。
sen.e: Together with Baien MIURA and Tanso HIROSE, it is said that he was one of the Bungo San-kenjin (three virtuous positions in Bungo Province).
Together with Baien MIURA and Tanso HIROSE, it is said that he was one of the Bungo San-kenjin (three virtuous positions in Bungo Province).
Together with Baien MIURA and Tanso HIROSE, it is said that he was one of the Bungo San-kenjin (three virtuous positions in Bungo Province).

sen.j: 1791年（寛政3年）万里が14歳の時、脇愚山に学び、21歳の時に大阪の中井竹山・京都の皆川淇園にも学ぶ。
sen.e: In 1791, when Banri was 14 years old, he studied under 脇愚山Guzan WAKI, and at the age of 21, he also took lessons of 中井竹山Chikuzan NAKAI in Osaka and 皆川淇園Kien MINAGAWA in Kyoto.
In 1791, when Banri was 14 years old, he studied under Guzan WAKI, and at the age of 21, he also took lessons of Chikuzan NAKAI in Osaka and Kien MINAGAWA in Kyoto.
In 1791, when Banri was 14 years old, he studied under Guzan WAKI, and at the age of 21, he also took lessons of Chikuzan NAKAI in Osaka and Kien MINAGAWA in Kyoto.

sen.j: その後30歳前後には一人前の学者となり、日出藩の藩校の教授となり、1832年（天保3年）日出藩家老となり財政改革に行った。
sen.e: Afterwards, he became a full-fledged scholar at around 30 and held the position of professor to hanko (domain school) of Hiji Domain, and in 1832 he was appointed as the chief retainer of Hiji Domain to carry out the domain's financial reform.

Afterwards, he became a full-fledged scholar at around 30 and held the position of professor to hanko (domain school) of Hiji Domain, and in 1832 he was appointed as the chief retainer of Hiji Domain to carry out the domain's financial reform.

Afterwards, he became a full-fledged scholar at around 30 and held the position of professor to hanko (domain school) of Hiji Domain, and in 1832 he was appointed as the chief retainer of Hiji Domain to carry out the domain's financial reform.

sen.j: 藩主の懇望を受けたが辞して承諾せず、「一度任せたからには、後から口出しをしない」という約束の下に、これまでの家老をやめさせた。
sen.e: Although the lord of domain implored him to take moderate approach but he did not listen to the lord's pleading, saying that he accepted the charge under the words that 'once having entrusted, nobody would interfere in the affaire afterwards,' and he brushed off the chief retainer in service
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: Although the lord of domain implored him to take moderate approach but he did not listen to the lord's pleading, saying that he accepted the charge under the words that 'once having entrusted, nobody would interfere in the affaire afterwards,' and he brushed off the chief retainer in service

Although the lord of domain implored him to take moderate approach but he did not listen to the lord's pleading, saying that he accepted the charge under the words that 'once having entrusted, nobody would interfere in the affaire afterwards,' and he brushed off the chief retainer in service

sen.j: そして、自分が有能・公正を見こんだ人々を役職につけ、倹約を旨とし、自ら算盤をとり藩の帳簿を調べ、これまでの役人の不正を明るみに出した。
sen.e: And he appointed those whom he recognized capable and fair the important positions, carried out the policy of austerity, and revealed the corruption of officials, checking the account books of the domain by moving beads on an abacus by himself.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: And he appointed those whom he recognized capable and fair the important positions, carried out the policy of austerity, and revealed the corruption of officials, checking the account books of the domain by moving beads on an abacus by himself.

And he appointed those whom he recognized capable and fair the important positions, carried out the policy of austerity, and revealed the corruption of officials, checking the account books of the domain by moving beads on an abacus by himself.

sen.j: 改革の3年後には、大いに成績をあげ、藩が大坂商人に借りていた金を返していく方針が立った。
sen.e: Three yeas later after the reform, he rendered a great achievement, and the clan was able to have a clear idea how to return the money borrowed from 大坂商人Osaka merchants
Three yeas later after the reform, he rendered a great achievement, and the clan was able to have a clear idea how to return the money borrowed from Osaka merchants
Three yeas later after the reform, he rendered a great achievement, and the clan was able to have a clear idea how to return the money borrowed from Osaka merchants

sen.j: 致仕した後、私塾西崦精舎（せいえんせいしゃ）を開いて子弟の教育にあたっている。
sen.e: After he 致仕retired from the post, he founded his private school Seienseisha to be engaged in the younger people's education.
After he retired from the post, he founded his private school Seienseisha to be engaged in the younger people's education.
After he retired from the post, he founded his private school Seienseisha to be engaged in the younger people's education.

sen.j: 1847年に万里はにわかに門人を引き連れて京都にあがり、翌年まで滞在していたことがある。
sen.e: In 1847, Banri suddenly went up to Kyoto leading several disciples and stayed there until next year.
In 1847, Banri suddenly went up to Kyoto leading several disciples and stayed there until next year.
In 1847, Banri suddenly went up to Kyoto leading several disciples and stayed there until next year.

sen.j: これは京都に学校を興してそれにより朝廷の威光を増そうという計画だったともいう。
sen.e: It is said that he did this because he was planning to strengthen the prestige of the Imperial Court by establishing a school in Kyoto.
It is said that he did this because he was planning to strengthen the prestige of the Imperial Court by establishing a school in Kyoto.
It is said that he did this because he was planning to strengthen the prestige of the Imperial Court by establishing a school in Kyoto.

sen.j: 75歳で没する。
sen.e: He died at the age of 75.
He died at the age of 75.
He died at the age of 75.

sen.j: 体は弱い方だったが、人一倍衛生を重んじ、食物に気をつけて養生したので長命を得たという。
sen.e: It is said that although he was rather delicate in health, he took care of himself by extremely valuing the hygiene and paying attention to what he ate, he enjoyed a long life.
It is said that although he was rather delicate in health, he took care of himself by extremely valuing the hygiene and paying attention to what he ate, he enjoyed a long life.
It is said that although he was rather delicate in health, he took care of himself by extremely valuing the hygiene and paying attention to what he ate, he enjoyed a long life.

sen.j: 万里は経学・史学・経世の学に専心したといわれる
sen.e: It is said that Banri focused his learnings in the studies of Confucianism (learning of Keisho that is the general term for most important literature in Confucianism; keigaku), history and Keiseigaku.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: It is said that Banri focused his learnings in the studies of Confucianism (learning of Keisho that is the general term for most important literature in Confucianism; keigaku), history and Keiseigaku.

It is said that Banri focused his learnings in the studies of Confucianism (learning of Keisho that is the general term for most important literature in Confucianism; keigaku), history and Keiseigaku.

sen.j: が、一方で、自然哲学者・三浦梅園の影響により窮理学に関心を持ち、40歳頃から藤林普山の『訳鍵』を手に入れてオランダ語を修得し、ヨーロッパの自然科学を学んだ。
sen.e: But on the other hand, he was interested in 窮理学Kyurigaku (learning of plumbing the scientific principles), influenced by a nature philosopher Baien MIURA, and at around 40, he learned Dutch using "訳鍵""Yakken" (Nederduitsche Taal, Japanese first Dutch-Japanese dictionary literally named 'key to translation') written by Fuzan FUJIBAYASHI to learn the natural science in Europe.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。窮理学→定訳不明：Kyurigaku (learning of plumbing the scientific principles)としました。『訳鍵』→定訳不明："Yakken" (Nederduitsche Taal, Japanese first Duch-Japanese dictionary literally named 'key to translation') としました。
sen.e: But on the other hand, he was interested in Kyurigaku (learning of plumbing the scientific principles), influenced by a nature philosopher Baien MIURA, and at around 40, he learned Dutch using "Yakken" (Nederduitsche Taal, Japanese first Dutch-Japanese dictionary literally named 'key to translation') written by Fuzan FUJIBAYASHI to learn the natural science in Europe.

But on the other hand, he was interested in Kyurigaku (learning of plumbing the scientific principles), influenced by a nature philosopher Baien MIURA, and at around 40, he learned Dutch using "Yakken" (Nederduitsche Taal, Japanese first Dutch-Japanese dictionary literally named 'key to translation') written by Fuzan FUJIBAYASHI to learn the natural science in Europe.

sen.j: その蘭学の範囲は、天文・物理・博物学・医学・地理などにわたる。
sen.e: The areas of Western learning he studied includes astronomy, 物理physics, natural history, medical science and 地理geography.
The areas of Western learning he studied includes astronomy, physics, natural history, medical science and geography.
The areas of Western learning he studied includes astronomy, physics, natural history, medical science and geography.

sen.j: 皇室を尊びながら偏狭ではなく、門下に西洋について学ぶものが多く出た。
sen.e: Following him many of his disciples began studying about the Western world without narrow-mindness, while they maintained the respect to the Imperial family.
Following him many of his disciples began studying about the Western world without narrow-mindness, while they maintained the respect to the Imperial family.
Following him many of his disciples began studying about the Western world without narrow-mindness, while they maintained the respect to the Imperial family.

sen.j: 万里の著書『窮理通（きゅうりつう）』は日本における自然科学史に画期的な文献である。
sen.e: Banri's book "Kyuritsu" is an epoch-making literature of natural science history in Japan.
Banri's book "Kyuritsu" is an epoch-making literature of natural science history in Japan.
Banri's book "Kyuritsu" is an epoch-making literature of natural science history in Japan.

sen.j: 明治年間にオランダのフルベッキが『窮理通』の説を聞き、江戸時代の科学の進んでいたことに驚いたという。
sen.e: It is said during the Meiji period when Guido Herman Fridolin Verbeek from the Netherlands came to know the theory of "Kyuritsu," he was surprised at the advanced level of the science in the Edo period.

It is said during the Meiji period when Guido Herman Fridolin Verbeek from the Netherlands came to know the theory of "Kyuritsu," he was surprised at the advanced level of the science in the Edo period.

It is said during the Meiji period when Guido Herman Fridolin Verbeek from the Netherlands came to know the theory of "Kyuritsu," he was surprised at the advanced level of the science in the Edo period.

sen.j: 「万里の本領は文章にある」とする見方は生前からあった。
sen.e: Even before his death, there had been an established view that 'Banri's 本領forte exists in his writing.
Even before his death, there had been an established view that 'Banri's forte exists in his writing.
Even before his death, there had been an established view that 'Banri's forte exists in his writing.

sen.j: 彼は「古文」を唱道して後進に教え、その古文は荻生徂徠と異なり、文字ではなく文体を古体に則る。
sen.e: He advocated the ancient writings and taught them to younger scholars, and his style of ancient writings was different from that of Sorai OGYU and he not only applied the classic letters but also classic literary styles in his writing.

He advocated the ancient writings and taught them to younger scholars, and his style of ancient writings was different from that of Sorai OGYU and he not only applied the classic letters but also classic literary styles in his writing.

He advocated the ancient writings and taught them to younger scholars, and his style of ancient writings was different from that of Sorai OGYU and he not only applied the classic letters but also classic literary styles in his writing.

sen.j: つまり、秦漢以前の文を模範とし、唐宋以下の文を骨力がなく軟弱であるとして軽んじた。
sen.e: That is to say, he modeled the writings after those of the periods of Qin-Han or before, and he did not appreciated the styles of 唐宋 Tang-Sung or later periods, saying that they were weak.
That is to say, he modeled the writings after those of the periods of Qin-Han or before, and he did not appreciated the styles of Tang-Sung or later periods, saying that they were weak.
That is to say, he modeled the writings after those of the periods of Qin-Han or before, and he did not appreciated the styles of Tang-Sung or later periods, saying that they were weak.

sen.j: たとえばその著書『井櫻纂聞』などは、「剄簡にして動かすべからざるの力あり」と評される。
sen.e: For example, his book "井櫻纂聞""Seio sanbun" (井櫻纂聞) is praised as '剄簡にして動かすべからざるの力あり''[i]t is concise but transmits a firm power.'
sen.cmt: 『井櫻纂聞』→正式な読み方が不明です："Seio sanbun" (井櫻纂聞) としました。「剄簡にして動かすべからざるの力あり」→定訳不明：'[i]t is concise but transmits a firm power.'としました。
sen.e: For example, his book "Seio sanbun" is praised as 'it is concise but transmits a firm power.'
For example, his book "Seio sanbun" is praised as 'it is concise but transmits a firm power.'

sen.j: 『東潜夫論（とうせんぷろん）』
sen.e: "Tosenpuron" (a critical commentary on the economic policies)
sen.cmt: 『東潜夫論（とうせんぷろん）』→定訳不明："Tosenpuron" (a critical commentary on the economic policies) としました。*以下著作の日本語ローマ字表記に（）内の説明を加えました。
sen.e: "Tosenpuron" (a critical commentary on the economic policies)
"Tosenpuron" (a critical commentary on the economic policies)

sen.j: 『仮名考』
sen.e: "仮名考""Kanako" (a study of the Japanese syllabary)
sen.cmt: 『仮名考』→定訳不明："Kanako" (a study of the Japanese syllabary)としました。
sen.e: "Kanako" (a study of the Japanese syllabary)
